title: Bhagavad Gītā
subtitle: The Song of the Lord
description: A dialogue between Lord Kṛṣṇa and Arjuna on dharma, karma, jñāna, and bhakti, forming the foundation of Vedāntic philosophy.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Arjuna's Dejection
chapters.summary: Arjuna's moral dilemma on the battlefield of Kurukṣetra, setting the stage for Kṛṣṇa's teachings.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Knowledge
chapters.summary: The foundational chapter introducing the immortal Ātman, the path of knowledge, and equanimity in action.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Action
chapters.summary: The importance of selfless action (niṣkāma karma) without attachment to results.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Knowledge and Renunciation of Action
chapters.summary: The divine incarnations, the nature of true knowledge, and the synthesis of knowledge and action.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Renunciation of Action
chapters.summary: The path of renunciation and its relationship to action performed without attachment.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Meditation
chapters.summary: The practice of meditation, control of the mind, and the characteristics of a true yogi.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Knowledge and Wisdom
chapters.summary: The distinction between lower and higher nature, and knowing the Lord through wisdom.

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Imperishable Brahman
chapters.summary: The nature of Brahman, the imperishable, and the path to liberation at the time of death.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Sovereign Knowledge and Sovereign Secret
chapters.summary: The supreme secret of devotion and the Lord's manifestation in all beings.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Divine Manifestations
chapters.summary: The glories and manifestations of the Divine in the world.

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Vision of the Universal Form
chapters.summary: Arjuna's vision of Kṛṣṇa's cosmic form (Viśvarūpa) and the awe it inspires.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Devotion
chapters.summary: The path of devotion and the qualities of a true devotee.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Discrimination between the Field and the Knower of the Field
chapters.summary: The distinction between the body (field) and the soul (knower of the field).

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Division of the Three Guṇas
chapters.summary: The three qualities of nature (sattva, rajas, tamas) and transcending them.

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Supreme Person
chapters.summary: The metaphor of the cosmic tree and the nature of the Supreme Puruṣa.

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Division between the Divine and Demoniacal
chapters.summary: The qualities of divine and demoniacal natures in human beings.

chapters.title: The Yoga of the Division of the Three Kinds of Faith
chapters.summary: The three types of faith corresponding to the three guṇas.

chapters.title: The Yoga of Liberation through Renunciation
chapters.summary: The culmination of all teachings: true renunciation, surrender, and final liberation.
